DataElement.preferredName: Blood Specimen Tube Collected CPTAC Biospecimen Identifier
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The CPTAC specimen identifier of the blood specimen collection tube.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A small volume of blood removed for testing or storage._Any device or component shaped like a hollow cylinder._The act of gathering things together; having been brought together in one place.

Concepts.definition: A small volume of blood removed for testing or storage.

Property.preferredDefinition: Any device or component shaped like a hollow cylinder.:The act of gathering things together; having been brought together in one place.

Concepts.definition: Any device or component shaped like a hollow cylinder.
The act of gathering things together; having been brought together in one place.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Tests, examinations, evaluations used to determine a subject's status or response to intervention.
ConceptualDomain.changeDescription: Created initially to support CCR value domain for CTMS.

DataElementConcept.origin: CPTAC: Clinical Proteomic Tumor Analysis Consortium
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 1/11/21 jk  Released per SME (NGM) review and approval.  Created for CPTAC AML Specimen Procurement Form. AK 2020-11-13

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The CPTAC specimen identifier in the format of [C3Y]-XXXXX- ZZ where Y is either N for NCI or L for Leidos, XXXXX is the case ID/kit id, and ZZ equals the type of specimen.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Any specific activity undertaken during the course of a clinical study or research protocol.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Clinical Proteomic Tumor Analysis Consortium Biospecimen Identifier
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A national effort to accelerate the understanding of the molecular basis of cancer through the application of large-scale proteome and genome analysis, or proteogenomics.:Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.:One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.

Concepts.definition: A national effort to accelerate the understanding of the molecular basis of cancer through the application of large-scale proteome and genome analysis, or proteogenomics.

Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.
One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.

ValueDomain.origin: CPTAC: Clinical Proteomic Tumor Analysis Consortium
ValueDomain.changeDescription: 1/22/20 jk released per CPTAC SME's review of PRAD Path Review CDE set. 1/6/20 jk created for CPTAC Path Review and Local Path CRFs; applicable to all tumor types.

DataElement.origin: CPTAC: Clinical Proteomic Tumor Analysis Consortium
DataElement.changeDescription: 2020-11-16 Ak Released per SME approval email. 9/29/20 jk added CPTAC Solid tumor procurement CSI. --- Created for CPTAC AML Specimen Procurement Form. AK 2020-9-3
